description: a(1) = 1; a(n) = sum of the sum and the product of all previous terms.
comments: The next term has 147 digits. [From Harvey P. Dale, Nov 01 2011]
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..13
example: a(4)=18 as 18 = {1+2+5} + {1*2*5}, where 1, 2, 5 are the previous terms.
mathematica: lf[l_List] := Append[l, Plus @@ l + Times @@ l]; Nest[f, {1}, 9] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 01 2011 *) and modified by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 03 2012
prog: (PARI) A062097(n,s=0,p=1)={for(n=2,n,p*=-s+s+=s+p);p+s} \\ - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 03 2012(Haskell)a062097 n = a062097_list !! (n-1)a062097_list = 1 : f 1 1 where   f u v = w : f (u + w) (v * w) where w = u + v-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 20 2014
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jun 19 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jun 19 2001
More terms from Harvey P. Dale, Nov 01 2011
